intro: Urophyllum borneense, commonly known as the Bornean starleaf, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite,革质 (leathery), and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Urophyllum borneense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
